Dear James Perlaki:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
10/27/23. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing
statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at .
Sincerely,
Venus M. Decker,
Child Welfare Licensing Consultant

IV. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules and statutes.
V. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• The agency did not require technical assistance.
VI. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• The agency did not require or request consultation.
VII. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during this
period under review.
Financial Overview
I reviewed the financial audit. The agency is in compliance.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
NA
Chief Administrator Assessment
The assessment is completed. There were no issues.
Staff and Youth Interviews
No concerns in staff interview.
No youth are currently placed to interview.

Description of Agency Walk Through
Agency is well kept. Agency has ideas to make the bedrooms more inviting.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
